net.cloud.client.file.cache

Class CachedFileRegion

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.client.file.cache.CachedFileRegion

  • public class CachedFileRegion
extends java.lang.Object
    A block of one or more CachedFile objects. In other words, a region of a cache file represented as each individual file. The region is contiguous, and so will contain all cached files from a starting index to an ending index (possibly the same for a single file)
    This object is obtained via a CachedFileRegionLoadRequest and allows access to the contained files.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The index of the last file in the region

      Each of the CachedFiles that make up this region

      The index of the first file of the region

    • Constructor Detail

      • CachedFileRegion

        public CachedFileRegion(int startIndex,
                        int endIndex)
        Created a new CachedFileRegion which will contain the CachedFiles in the designated block of the cache file. The block must be at least one CachedFile (endIndex >= startIndex) and the cached files will need to be set into this region as they are loaded. Until then they will be null.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - First file in the region. 0 <= startIndex <= endIndex
        endIndex - Last file in the region. startIndex <= endIndex < # files in region
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the indices are invalid

    • Method Detail

      • placeFileAbs

        public void placeFileAbs(int index,
                         CachedFile file)
        Place a file into the region once it has been loaded. (This object does not handle loading the regions on its own) The index must fit within the region
        Parameters:
        index - The absolute index of the file in the cache. Not relative to the region
        file - The CachedFile which has been loaded and is now being assigned to the region
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the index is out of this region's bounds

      • placeFileRel

        public void placeFileRel(int index,
                         CachedFile file)
        Place a file into the region once it has been loaded. (This object does not handle loading the regions on its own) The index is relative, so the first file in the region has index 0.
        Parameters:
        index - The relative index of the file within this region
        file - The CachedFile which has been loaded and is now being assigned to the region

      • getFileAbs

        public CachedFile getFileAbs(int index)
        Obtain a file from this region. This uses the absolute index of the file within the entire cache. Of course, the index must be in bounds. Fear the ArrayIndexOutOfBounds exception!
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the file within the entire cache
        Returns:
        The CachedFile at the index, or null if it was never loaded

      • getFileRel

        public CachedFile getFileRel(int index)
        Obtain a file from this region. This uses the relative index of the file within this particular region. Of course, the index must be in bounds. Fear the ArrayIndexOutOfBounds exception!
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the file relative to this region
        Returns:
        The CachedFile at the index, or null if it was never loaded

      • getFileIterator

        public java.util.Iterator<CachedFile> getFileIterator()
        Obtain an iterator which will iterate over all of the CachedFiles contained in this region
        Returns:
        An iterator which will iterate over all of the CachedFiles contained in this region
